page.title: 17Badlesmere : Energy
page.content: An overhead line of electricity pylons crosses the area from West to East. Electricity is supplied to all houses by overhead cable, so power breakdowns are a problem particularly since many homes are not linked to any other energy source. Supplies of candles and oil lamps are kept for such emergencies. A gas main follows the A25l and mains gas is piped to most properties along it. Gas is still the cheapest fuel for cooking and heating. Alternatives to gas and electric cookers are Aga Stoves (oil or solid fuel burning), Calor gas and solid fuel stoves. Many central heating systems are oil fired. Because of the high cost of heating fuel and availability of wood due to Dutch Elm Disease many homes are installing wood burning stoves for cooking and heating
